entry.string: Overview
What is it?
The Blogger API is a XML-RPC API used for blogging. The API is very simple and is basically a way to exchange strings between xmlrpc clients and servers.
In Xaraya the xmlrpcserver module is responsible for providing the xmlrpc transport needed for the Blogger API functionality. This module will not function without that module activated.

In addition to that, the xmlrpcserver module needs one or more API modules activated to actually do anything. The bloggerAPI is one such module. It is advised that the xmlrpcsystemAPI module is also activated.
You can find the specification of the Blogger API at
Little survival guide for using Blogging tools with Xaraya
Make sure you have enabled the following modules
XmlRpcServer
Categories
Articles

When these modules are activated, configure the categories modules and create some categories which should hold the postings made from Blogs. While not necessary, it is advised to create a publication type for blog postings specifically and link this type to the category-tree you created for blog postings.
Go into the config section of the BloggerAPI module and configure the publication type to use for blog postings. Select either News articles or your publication type which you created.
Basically you're all set now to start blogging. Use your favorite tool for managing your blog postings. For windows we recommend
